meanings.definition: The office or department of a government secretary.
meanings.sent1: The secretariat managed all the paperwork for the government secretary.
meanings.sent2: The secretariat was responsible for organizing meetings and handling correspondence.
meanings.sent3: The secretariat accidentally mixed up all the files and caused a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The secretariat was the heart of the office, keeping everything running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The secretariat's efficiency was unmatched, ensuring all tasks were completed on time.

meanings.definition: A group of secretaries or officials who assist an executive or organization.
meanings.sent1: The secretariat worked together to support the CEO in all administrative tasks.
meanings.sent2: The secretariat met regularly to coordinate their efforts and improve efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The secretariat decided to have a fun team-building day to boost morale.
meanings.sent4: The secretariat was like a well-oiled machine, each member playing a crucial role.
meanings.sent5: The secretariat's dedication was evident in their commitment to excellence.

meanings.definition: The administrative staff or office of an international organization.
meanings.sent1: The secretariat of the United Nations handled diplomatic affairs with expertise.
meanings.sent2: The secretariat of the organization was responsible for coordinating global initiatives.
meanings.sent3: The secretariat hosted a multicultural potluck to celebrate diversity.
meanings.sent4: The secretariat was the backbone of the organization, ensuring its success worldwide.
meanings.sent5: The secretariat's professionalism set a high standard for international cooperation.
